formatted_address: Buangkok Cres, Buangkok Square Park, Singapore
name: Buangkok Water Park

reviews.text: Water Park deep in the Suburbs. SIMPLE features but pure paradise for young children. After water fun, McDonald's for your young children at the mall next door. "Fairy tale" ending for the children. Check opening hours before going. It's FREE !!!

place is closed with no sign indication on how long and why. only pad lock. yet the whole water park is running and water flowing.

edit: they only put up the sign at the other gate where people don't actually walk to. and apparently it's been closed since 7.7.24 , it is 21.9.24 , yet not open. someone sleeping at their job.

A decent neighbourhood water park with just enough play areas and water sprays. It’s not as fun as the bigger ones but fun enough for a free waterpark. There are two shower areas. Ample parking at buangkok mall nearby. When we came it was empty and the water wasnt on. i think there are sensors to save water. So you gotta manually switch it on. Overall we had a fun time!

the board stated 8am-8pm…. but when i bring
my 2 kids there at 7pm… the light are off… water are off…havent 8pm already close??? than y stated 8am-8pm? wasting my time all the way go there … n my kids are sad n disappointed…

The Aquatic-themed Water Playground offers many splash elements, including a Dragonfly spray fountain, a spray tunnel and even a mini splashing bucket and many other water fountains scattered around the playground.
